definitions.definition: The purchase of one company by another; a merger without the formation of a new company, especially where some stakeholders in the purchased company oppose the purchase.
The acquisition of a public company whose shares are listed on a stock exchange , in contrast to the acquisition of a private company.
A time or event in which control or authority , especially over a facility is passed from one party to the next.

main_definition: ( economics ) The purchase of one company by another; a merger without the formation of a new company, especially where some stakeholders in the purchased company oppose the purchase.
secondary_definitions: ( economics , UK ) The acquisition of a public company whose shares are listed on a stock exchange , in contrast to the acquisition of a private company.
A time or event in which control or authority , especially over a facility is passed from one party to the next.
